English: Hello, how are you?
My name is John.
Thank you.
Please.
Goodbye.

Spanish: La casa es grande y blanca.
English: The sky is blue.
The car is fast.
The food is hot.
The book is interesting.
The house is big and white.

Spanish: Ayer fui al parque con mis amigos.
English: What did you do yesterday?
I like going to the movies.
I don’t understand the question.
Could you speak more slowly?
Yesterday I went to the park with my friends.

Spanish: Si tuviera dinero, viajaría por el mundo.
Cuando era niño, me gustaba jugar al fútbol.
Estoy aprendiendo español para mejorar mi carrera.
Si hubiera sabido, habría llegado temprano.
Aunque llueva, iré a la fiesta.
English: If I had money, I would travel the world.
When I was a child, I liked to play soccer.
I am learning Spanish to improve my career.
If I had known, I would have arrived early.
Even if it rains, I will go to the party.

Spanish: A pesar de sus esfuerzos, no logró el éxito.
Nunca había experimentado un silencio tan elocuente.
La película, aunque larga, mantuvo mi interés hasta el final.
Es tal su elocuencia que convence a cualquiera.
El libro aborda la complejidad de las emociones humanas.
English: Despite his efforts, he did not achieve success.
I had never experienced such eloquent silence.
The movie, though long, held my interest to the end.
Such is his eloquence that he convinces anyone.
The book addresses the complexity of human emotions.
